alert.note: Alert for Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 18 at 3:32PM EDT until March 19 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches with localized totals up to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph will cause areas of blowing snow. * WHERE...Southeastern St. Lawrence, Southern Franklin and Western Essex Counties. * WHEN...From 5 PM Today to 2 PM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel at times due to snow covered roads and poor visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Greatest snowfall accumulations will occur towards locations along NY Route 3 such as Wanakena and Tupper Lake. Heaviest snow is expected between 2 and 8 AM, with blowing snow more likely after that time.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Be prepared for rapidly changing road conditions and visibilities. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Western Essex
